reviews.review_msg: Dr. Pappas was very intimidating at first, but he's clearly a skilled teacher and knows how to get concepts across. He's very "tough love". I learned so much from him, and the TAs were fantastic. The quizzes & readings were extremely helpful for both the assignments and exams, and the class itself is more based on effort than being correct.

The material isn't very hard to understand if you put in a bit of time, although his lectures are just him going over the homework or readings from the week before. Essentially you want to learn everything on your on and go to class to make sure you actually know whats going on. He is very nice outside of lecture but he does seem intimating

He has a pretty interesting class structure, there's modules with quizzes you have to complete every week and you can't do the next module without completing the prior one, so it forces you to learn the material. He's a pretty intimidating prof but he seems pretty nice and was extremely generous in the participation marks. exams were also easy

Fairly average in terms of work, easy quizzes for readings which help with grasping the readings. Written work is based on argumentation and structure of processes when breaking down a dataset, not based on correctness which is helpful when learning and applying processes. Lectures are great and come full circle on reading and written assignments!
The worst, only took his class because I needed it for my major

This class was generally okay, but the professor took the quality down significantly. Attendance was not mandatory, but every time I was at a lecture, he would be explaining the previous week's assignments that everyone had already done. I am a linguistics major, so I have taken some LING courses before, and this was by far the most frustrating.

Seemed inimidating at first, but in office hours he is VERY approachable, definitley values students feedback, very accesible outside class and outside of schuled OH times, can be a bit blunt, but thats just his character so idgaf. will 100% take another class with him.

Dr. Pappas is very passionate about linguistics. He makes himself available outside of class through office hours or booking private appointments. Asking questions is a huge part of participation. His criteria for assignments were unclear and often times his explanations were too. If you work hard though, it is not difficult to get a good grade.

It was the first intersession class he'd ever taught, and the pace was super quick. However, he made it as easy as possible for us to do well. A funny, inspiring lecturer as well as a bit of a hard marker. You definitely have to show up to every class and do all the reading if you want to pass. Would recommend you take him for this course.
Pappas is a good prof if you're an attentive student with initiative on projects, if not, good luck. You won't get specific criteria if you don't ask.

First of all, his syllabus is disorganised. The deadlines and other important things are not listed clearly. It's the same for his instructions on assignments. He doesn't give clear instructions on how to do the assignments which makes me very confused.

Panos has a lot to offer within the field of sociolinguistics. He deals primarily with grad students (MA and PhD), so I think as a default, he comes to expect a lot from students. That can be a little intimidating for undergrads; some of the instructions for assignments could've been clearer. However, course material was relevant and engaging.

One of my fav courses which wasn't easy, by any means, but if you put in a little effort and keep up with the readings (well selected, relevant ones that he provides on canvas) you will do just fine. Pappas is truly passionate about sociolinguistics, provides many anecdotes and meaningful insights throughout that supplement the course nicely.

Terrible prof. Used TopHat for the first time this semester and it seemed like no one taught him how to use it. Attend for the attendance & pop quiz. Frequently cancels office hours due to his carpal tunnel. Refuses to post lecture notes on Canvas. Assignments are all essays but easy. If Pocholo's ur TA, you can learn the course from him in off hrs

Pappas is by far the worst Professor I have had at SFU.  His notes aren't clear and he whines when students don't understand his poor explanations.  He tests students on things that weren't in the textbook, on assignments or in lecture as he wants to test "beyond their comprehension to see who really know it".  Would NOT recommend.

Dr. Pappas is a kind man and an amazing professor. The students that disagree seem be those who aren't willing to put in the effort to get a decent grade. He wants everyone to do well, is very accessible for extra help and always willing to help students understand material in class. Arrive on time and participate in class! He rewards effort.

I get pretty bad exam anxiety and this exam based course was cake. He would show clips from The Wire (best show) was fair with grades. No written assignments, weekly clicker quizzes that were based on really short articles that took like 10 minutes to read and understand. People that say he gives a lot of assignments... welcome to university.....
Wonderful prof with a passion for historical linguistics. Very understanding and accommodating. He wants everyone to do well.

Dr. Pappas is great! He is knowledgeable and helpful. I am graduating pretty soon and I ended up getting A from this class. Contents of this course are challenging, but Dr. Pappas explains them clearly. Paper was fun to write. I totally recommend this course.

The level of interest for this course was almost 0%, but it turned out that this course was the most interesting course at SFU!!! Also, I liked the way he graded. I only have two terms left at SFU and I now found my interest in writing. I can't believe a 'W' course can be a GPA booster. Take it with him :)
His explanation in lec is not clear, u can never ask him questions after lec or tut. He will let u to go to his office hours to do that. Mean prof.
Very mean prof and hard exam! Avoid this prof. Take your gpa down.
Such a bad prof. No lec notes he didt even teach!
superhard exam?super bad prof

Laziest prof ever. Reads from his ppt which are poorly made with screenshot from wikipedia and content from other universties with inconsistent ugly background. Assignments are hardly relevant to the course and the marking is unfair from TAs. Makes horrible jokes all day to cover his bad teaching and cancels classes when he does not want to attend
All okay except the exam.
Lec is okay, but he is not helpful and exam is hard!
He doesn't even teach stuff in lec, no notes related to exam, bad prof
So regret in took his course, he is mean and exam is hard! Don't take it!
superhard? dont take his course!
He deleted the lec notes! And not a helpful prof. Exam is hard, yu have to read the whole book.
We got our grade today, so many people said we miss some marks for no reason. And when u contact him, he is irresponsibility to answer all the questions! Bad bad bad bad bad bad teacher!
Mean teacher! Hard exam! Don't take his course! So much stuff to do. Presentations, assignment, I clickers...
avoid this prof, he is so mean and no patient to answer questions. It's not possible to ask him questions after tut, he never answer it!
Such a bad teacher! Exam was super hard! 75% is only a C+, he is mean!
The worst prof I never had before. Helpless! Don't take his course! Exam was very hard.

Notes were also very organized and detailed. It made things crystal clear to me when I brought questions with me to lectures. Very patient when answering questions in class.It's not easy to get a good grade?but as long as you go through all the notes?you will be fine.
please avoid him at all cost. not a great prof picky on his markings.

I liked this course. Dr. Pappas is very engaged in this topic of Language, Culture and Society. He uses multiple choice tests, and they get tricky. It is really hard to get even a B in this class, because he scales it all down. Not a GPA booster.

He won't give out his PPT notes, so you need to keep copying notes during the class. He encourages questions in class. However, Pappas seems school policy strictly. And he has a set of his own rules, don't try to break them. Following tightly his instruction and you will be fine. He cares about the attendance in class.
He is really really boring and goes on and on about greek. He made us hand in the assignment before class so we'll have to attend classes.

Great Prof! Honestly. He loves ling, and has a great way of teaching. Participate in class and you will get a lot out of it. Only bad thing is his grading scale which makes it very hard to get and A or A+. I got an A- with 90%. But tests are very fair.
Boring and a hard marker. He doesn't give any feedback on the final term paper or return the paper to you. He is grumpy when you visit his office.
Can't teach, hard marker, does not like it when students ask him questions. Seems like he's not really happy with the job he has.

Here's the thing - the reason why he has fairly high ratings on this site is because his class is EXTREMELY EASY. However, this class does not prepare you for what's next in the Linguistics field. He TEACHES YOU NOTHING. If you wanna pursue Linguistics, you're gonna fail all the courses to come (upper level). Don't take this class with him!

One of the most horrible sfu profs.unclear,its more interesting to read a boring book than attend his lectures.He can't use emails, sometimes can't answer students'questions.Grading is strict even though he get stuck. Few TAs are not qualified.He wastes lecture time,he even brought a dog to lecture!

Bad prof. He made many mistakes when marking and he's very unclear during lectures. Fairly easy material but his marking is skewed. Many people did well during the course but ended up with poor grades.
Fairy easy class, just DO THE HOMEWORK, it's all practise. And go to office hours for help he will help you!

AWESOME prof!! my favorite ling professor at SFU. very likeable guy, super approachable and if you have questions go see him in his office hours he is extremely helpful! Grading system is high but fair. Homework is based on completion then he has students present to make sure everyone understands how to go about it.

Lectures were straight forward, nothing to interesting, nothing to boring.  He loves class discussions, participate if he asks questions.  I got one of my lowest uni marks with him, but he is a decent prof.  Do the work and you'll be fine.
seriously, i would never take his class again.... NEVER

Took 322,323,301 with him. Extremely easy marker, assignments 20% weighed upon completion and 10% for presentation of the answers of hmk assignments relatively easy papers are straight forward. High marking scale, but still capable in getting a good mark. He enjoys class discussions and in-depth research towards class topic.
Nice prof. Very understanding.
He's a very good lecturer.  He's at his best when in discussion with students, so speak up in class.  Tests are fair and pretty much exactly what we did in class.
Didn't provide enough in class instruction and refused to provide any proper text for the course
Fails to provide students with proper resources for class. No textbooks and poor class materials. His grading system is extremely difficult. Avoid taking classes with him.
very organized, very clear, great prof. however, he can be somewhat of a hard-ass and intimidating. plough through the work and you'll be fine!

nice prof, but expect too much. grading is pretty fair, cz u don't need to get 100% correct on the assignments but u can still get full mark as long as ur ans. satisified him lor. his temper is weird,so u feel stressed in class when he is unhappy? and when he is happy he is nice...

Generally liked him, and in a friendly disposition, but has a mean steak in him.  Classes were useful, i learned alot, but again he expects a little too much at times.  Fairly easy marker, midterms were only 1-2 pages, yet the oral exam may be a little sketchy.  AND DON'T COME LATE TO HIS CLASSES!

awsome! He is very organized, knowledgable and helpful.He encourages you to ask questions and answers your e-mails as fast as he can.Syntax in itself is not easy but he knows how to teach.That's for sure.If you are interested in syntax, this course will be unforgetable.

Disappointing class. Slow moving and the online part was a waste of time. Pappas himself: kind of insecure and in need of being seen as an authority figure, so not the most comfortable learning atmosphere. He can be nice enough, but watch out, because he can totally blow up in class. Not pretty!

he's a really nice teacher and he makes tutorials really laid back. If you don't like to participate, this is not the class for you. He likes to go around the class person to person. His midterm is easier than expected. 1 page! Hw is all or nothing. No makeup quizzes(2)/midterms(2)!

His teaching isn't consistant. For most of the time, he confuses his students. Midterm was hard and he blamed us for not understanding syntax. Sometimes he doesn't even know how to answer his own questions correctly. He doesn't know how to teach!!!
Never made any sense in lecture and seems like using the lecture time to do his own studying. Tests seemed straightforward, but it ruins everything with his high grading system.
Doesn't seem to like to answer questions, or have the patience for those who ask them.  Very easy tests, but that's offset by the very high grading scale.
Good teacher, and his tests are very easy if you pay attention in class.  He is a little difficult however, mabe expecting a little too much at times.
